<p>London, England - As I sit in the car park of a hotel just outside Heathrow&#039;s perimeter fence, I can actually hear the conversations emanating from the dozen or so other TV crews camped here.</p>
<p>The world&#039;s busiest airport remains shut.</p>
<p>Earlier a dozen or so maintenance workers walked the length of the northern runway, presumably a normal procedure but done in the early hours, looking for debris or whatever.</p>
<p>When I arrived at hotel, a group of children from the Middle East were happily kicking a football around the lobby. That lobby is usually full of flight attendants checking in our out.</p>
<p>The hotel also is offering a flat Â£10 lunch for those without food vouchers from an airline. That&#039;s about half what we would spend just on a sandwich and coke at this place.</p>
<p>A flew airplanes are being moved around the tarmac and there is the faint sound of an engine firing up. But inside and outside the airport, people are just sitting and waiting and hoping.</p>
